sub_title: Research Analyst at Leiden University Medical Center
summary: Experienced research analyst in the field of Electron Microscopy, knowledgeable, self-motivated, able to carry out multidisciplinary research, and continuously looking for improvements and outstanding results.

projects.title: Various Nephrology projects and facility projects
projects.description:
Working mainly on large projects in collaboration with the Nephrology Department from LUMC
and several facility projects. Some examples:

•	Maturation and vascularization of the kidney organoids
•	Kidney scaffolds recellularization
•	Endothelial glycocalyx in diabetic nephropathy
•	Structure and function of the endothelial glycocalyx in the microcirculation

contributors.headline: Research Analyst at Leiden University Medical Center

projects.title: Zebrafish morphological atlas and facility projects
projects.description:
•	Realization of a large scale morphological zebrafish atlas available for e-learning 
•	Study of cartilage ultra-structure in proteoglycan-deficient zebrafish mutants
•	Contributed to creating an ultra large high resolution electron microscopy map of a zebrafish for the “Cell Zoomer” exhibit of the Naturalis Biodiversity Center in Leiden and an exhibit of the Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen in Rotterdam
•	Destruction of tissue, cells and organelles in type 1 diabetic rats, presented at macromolecular resolution
•	Some small internal or facility projects

courses.name: 3View System and Digital Micrograph Basic Training

profile_positions.description:
While I have been working as research analyst in the Electron Microscopy facility and acquiring expertise in various techniques related to Transmission, Scanning, Volume Electron Microscopy (SBF-SEM) and Array Tomography, I have been also acting as a liaison between multidisciplinary research teams, leading numerous collaborative projects on behalf of the EM group.

Some of my key contributions to maintaining and extending the collaborations:
•	Ensuring an efficient and productive cooperation with the partner research groups
•	Contributing to fundraising for new projects, creating opportunities for starting new collaborations
•	Major contributions in delivering the projects on time and with high quality and original research results 
Expertise:
•	Initiating projects and implementing new ideas into action
•	Planning, and ensuring smooth project workflows 
•	Recommending approaches and techniques to collaborators, tailored on project
•	Providing high quality and original research results used in published articles, conference or fundraising presentations, exhibitions in the "Naturalis" and "Boijmans Van Beuningen" museums, and material available for e-learning for medical students
•	Performing data analysis and interpretation, giving presentations, and discussing the results with collaborators
•	Contributing to writing scientific articles
•	Performing protocols’ optimization and validation
•	Providing research input and technical support to Postdocs, PhD students, Master students, and electron microscope users 
•	Expertise in Electron Microscopy imaging (TEM, SEM and Serial Block Face SEM)
•	Skilled in various techniques related to Transmission, Scanning and Volume Electron Microscopy (Serial Block Face SEM) and Array Tomography such as: chemical fixation, high pressure freezing, freeze substitution, ultra-sectioning (plastic and Tokuyasu), and immuno-labelling
•	Experience in cell culturing (HUVEC’s and HeLa cells)
profile_positions.title: Research Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Faculty of Geosciences - Biogeochemistry
Interdisciplinary research in Physical Chemistry and Microbiology

Activities and applied techniques: 
•	Basic methods for cultivation of bacteria
•	Spectrophotometric determination of Mn(II), protein like substances and carbohydrates
•	Polarographic determination of “free” ions of Zn2+, Mn2+ and Cu2+
•	Basic approach of adsorption studies in batch conditions
•	Theoretical and practical basis of X-ray spectroscopy studies (EXAFS and XANES)
Achievements:
•	September 2007, European Synchrotron Radiation Facilities (Grenoble, France) - performed EXAFS and XANES studies of precipitates formed by living Shewanella putrefaciens bacteria at the contact with Mn(II)
•	Two scientific articles and a conference paper were published using the results acquired during the internship.
profile_positions.title: Internship Trainee

skills: Serial Block Face Scanning Electron Microscopy
